alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 5:12PM EDT until June 28 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL OXFORD, NORTHEASTERN CARROLL AND SOUTHEASTERN COOS COUNTIES... At 512 PM EDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms that produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bartlett, Lovell, Jackson, Chatham, Gilead, Stowe, Batchelders Grant, Shelburne, Stoneham and Mason. This includes the following Rec locations... Speckled Mountain, Evans Notch, Kearsarge North , Caribou Mountain, North Baldface, South Baldface, Mount Doublehead, West Royce Mountain, Mountain Pond, East Royce Mountain and Deer Hills. Short lull in rain is expected through 6 PM before a second round of rainfall will move the area bringing additional rainfall this evening. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
